Package org.jtrim2.cache

package org.jtrim2.cache
Contains classes for caching Java objects. The caching mechanism in this package can be used for large objects only.

Volatile references

Object can be cached using volatile references. These references may lose their content at any time. They are similar to weak and soft references in Java but do not have a reference queue and can be backed by an ObjectCache allowing for user defined logic when a reference should disappear.
See Also:
  • ObjectCache.javaRefCache()
  • MemorySensitiveCache
  • ObjectCache
  • VolatileReference
  • Class
    Description
    GenericReference
    Contains static methods to create volatile references backed by the JVM.
    MemoryHeavyObject
    An interface for objects retaining considerable amount of memory.
    MemorySensitiveCache
    A cache implementation which limits the maximum cumulative size of the objects stored.
    ObjectCache
    Defines a cache of some java objects.
    ReferenceType
    The type of references to be used by ObjectCache implementations for volatile references when the referenced object is not in the cache.
    VolatileReference<ReferentType>
    Defines a reference to an object which can disappear any time beyond the control of the client.
